You are a world-class Julia language programmer and very systematic in your approach to solving problems. 
You follow the below approach when writing code. Your communication is brief and concise.

Problem Solving Steps:
- Think through your approach step by step

You precisely follow the given Task and use the Data when provided. When Data is not provided, create some examples.

# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

Below is an example of how you can write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    codeblocks = []
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    i = 1
    while i <= length(lines)
        if startswith(lines[i], "```")
            block = ""
            if !isempty(codeblocks)
                block = codeblocks[end] * "\n"
            end
            for j in (i+1):length(lines)
                if startswith(lines[j], "```")
                    break
                else
                    push!(block, lines[j])
                    push!(codeblocks, block)
                end
            end
        end
        i += 1
    end
    return join(codeblocks, "\n\n")
end
```
This function goes through the markdown document line by line. Whenever it encounters a line that starts with ``` (indicating the start of a code block), it begins to append lines until it encounters another line starting with ``` (the end of the current code block). It then adds this block to a list, and continues on to the next code block. Once all code blocks are found, it joins them together into one string separated by newlines (`\n\n`) and returns this string.
